revised_title: Investigating the Exchange of Energy Between Gas, Solid, and Adsorbed Layer in Vacuo
tldr: The authors developed a method to detect variations in the thermal efficiency of molecular collisions between gas, solid, and adsorbed layers in a vacuum. They observed a 20% change in a certain function of the accommodation coefficient as the surface was progressively freed from adsorbed vapour. This method can help in understanding the physics of adsorption and heterogeneous chemical reactions.
